values.name: derived-from
values.description: STIX 2.0: The information in the target object is based on information from the source object.

values.name: duplicate-of
values.description: STIX 2.0: The referenced source and target objects are semantically duplicates of each other.

values.name: related-to
values.description: STIX 2.0: Asserts a non - specific relationship between two SDOs. This relationship ca n be used when none of the other predefined relationships are appropriate.

values.name: attributed-to
values.description: STIX 2.0: This Relationship describes that the Intrusion Set or Threat Actor that is involved in carrying out the Campaign.

values.name: targets
values.description: STIX 2.0: This Relationship describes that the Campaign uses exploits of the related Vulnerability or targets the type of victims described by the related Identity.

values.name: uses
values.description: STIX 2.0: This Relationship describes that attacks carried out as part of the Campaign typically use the related Attack Pattern, Malware, or Tool.

values.name: indicates
values.description: STIX 2.0: This Relationship describes that the Indicator can detect evidence of the related Campaign, Intrusion, or Threat Actor. This evidence may not be direct: for example, the Indicator may detect secondary evidence of the Campaign, such as malware or behavior commonly used by that Campaign.

values.name: mitigates
values.description: STIX 2.0: This Relationship describes that the Course of Action can mitigate the related Attack Pattern, Malware, Vulnerability, or Tool.

values.name: variant-of
values.description: STIX 2.0: This Relationship is used to document that one piece of Malware is a variant of another piece of Malware.

values.name: impersonates
values.description: STIX 2.0: This Relationship describes that the actor is the real identity represented in the related Identity.

values.name: authored-by
values.description: This relationship describes the author of a specific object.

values.name: located
values.description: This relationship describes the location (of any type) of a specific object.

values.name: included-in
values.description: This relationship describes an object included in another object.

values.name: analysed-with
values.description: This relationship describes an object analysed by another object.

values.name: claimed-by
values.description: This relationship describes an object claimed by another object.

description: Default type of relationships in MISP objects.
name: relationships
